page.title: 02INDUSTRY IN DELABOLE
page.content:
The Quarry.
Delabole Quarry has been worked for at least 500 years, probably longer. It is now an immense pit over 500 feet deep and over a mile in circumference. Slate brought up from the pit is used for roofing slates of different sizes; slabs for paving , grave stones or name plates; building stone; granules for use on roofing felt and powder which is used as a filler in paint etc. The quarry was taken over by Rio Tinto Zinc in 1984 and a great deal of money is being spent in moving the massive rubble tips to reveal new beds of slate.
